ISSUE.TITLE: Bug: Grouping by lookup column does not display the group name
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this ### Steps to reproduce ? I have a table with this schema: ![image](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/assets/91682637/f57d54ac-4856-454b-9ce3-89f8fe5b5c38) Where "Tasks" is linked to a "Tasks" table and "Project" is a lookup to this table. The idea is, that the user only needs to choose the task from the link candidates and the Project is filled in automatically. That works. However, creating a Grid view where I group first by project and then by task, results in ![image](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/assets/91682637/e3e0aadd-5c65-44f6-a16d-fa969d33a031) The Project name is missing even though the grouping works. ### Desired Behavior The name of the group should be displayed when using a lookup column as a grouping variable. ### Project Details Node: **v18.18.2** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.202.10** ### Attachments _No response_

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #7469 from nocodb/nc-fix/missing-catch fix: missing catch on export service
